name: DCH Accommodation Status
description: A CodeSystem to identify a type of accommodation.

concept.definition: Shared ownership scheme e.g. Social Homebuy Scheme (tenant purchase percentage of home value from landlord)

concept.display: Tenant - Local Authority/Arms Length Management Organisation/Registered Landlord

concept.definition: Night shelter/emergency hostel/Direct access hostel (temporary accommodation accepting self referrals, no waiting list and relatively frequent vacancies)

concept.display: Sofa surfing (sleeps on different friends floor each night)
Placed in temporary accommodation by Local Authority
concept.definition: Placed in temporary accommodation by Local Authority (including Homelessness resettlement service) e.g. Bed and Breakfast accommodation

concept.display: Staying with friends/family as a short term guest
Accommodation with mental health care support
Supported accommodation (by staff or resident caretaker)
concept.definition: Supported accommodation (accommodation supported by staff or resident caretaker)

concept.display: Supported lodgings (lodgings supported by staff or resident caretaker)
Supported group home (supported by staff or resident caretaker)
Other accommodation with mental health care and support
Other acute/long stay healthcare residential facility/hospital
Accommodation with other (not specialist mental health) care support
Foyer - accommodation for people aged 16-25 - homeless or in housing need
concept.definition: Foyer - accommodation for young people aged 16-25 who are homeless or in housing need

concept.display: Other accommodation with care and support (not specialist mental health)
Other accommodation with criminal justice support such as ex-offender support
Sheltered Housing (with a scheme manager or warden)
concept.definition: Sheltered Housing (accommodation with a scheme manager or warden living on the premises or nearby, contactable by an alarm system if necessary)

concept.display: Extra care sheltered housing (also known as 'very sheltered housing')
concept.definition: Extra care sheltered housing (also known as 'very sheltered housing'. For people who are less able to manage on their own, but who do need an extra level of care. Services offered vary between schemes, but meals and some personal care are often provided.)
